TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PageCatalogPartDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPartDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PageCatalogPart> class acts as a page catalog to maintain any controls previously added to the page that a user has closed, so that the user can add them back to the page. This control is visible only when a Web page is in catalog display mode. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.PageCatalogPartDesigner> class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PageCatalogPart> class.
In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.PageCatalogPart> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the HTML that is used to represent the control at design time.
Docs.returns: The HTML markup used to represent the control at design time.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the control.
